title: A Rising Dollar Is Hurting Other Currencies. Central Banks are Stepping In.
description: The Federal Reserveâ€™s interest rate hikes are unsettling global markets and prompting other central banks to prop up their domestic currencies.
dc:creator: Joe Rennison and Jeanna Smialek
media:credit: Noriko Hayashi for The New York Times
media:description: Outside a securities firm in Tokyo. Last week, the Japanese yen fell to its weakest level against the dollar since 1990, down more than 23 percent for the year.
